attributes.comment:
It it our understanding that there maybe a 66% increase on fees for foreign
adoptions. I just don't see how this is fair when the families that are adopting are
already out a large amount of money due to there being no financial assitance for
most families that adopt. Yes, adoption is a choice but in one way we are already
penalized due to insurance and employers not recongnizing adoption as a need
like being in the hospital and giving birth to a baby. Please reconsider keeping the
fees as they are. After a pregnant lady gives birth with her employer she is
allowed at least six weeks of paid time at home to bond with the baby adoptive
families are not extended this same kindness. The adoptive families have to burn
all vacation and sick time when we need this same time to bond with our babies
just the same. So any money that we can save on fees can most definitely be
used after we are home to allow us to stay at home for a few extra days with our
babies. Thanks for listening and please please consider leaving the fees as they
are.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Marty & Tammy Mask
